transcript.text: [Music]
hi and welcome you listening to the x-22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 856 and today's date is December
31st 2015 and the title of the episode
is the current economic collapse news
brief now before I get started I just
want to wish everyone a happy and
healthy and safe new year let's get
right into the economic collapse news
now during this past year we have seen
the initial jobless claims continually
decline challenger gran christmas is
continually reporting layoffs we've been
reporting on layoffs all throughout this
year if we go back and I've said this
many times if we go back to June of 2014
to the current year of this year
December we're approaching a million
layoffs but no one is claiming anything
it makes no sense but recently in the
last month or two during the holiday
season where more and more people are
getting employed with these part-time
jobs because companies and delivery
companies and stores need extra help for
the non-existing rush but what you're
seeing the initial claims surged by
20,000 this is the largest weekly rise
since february of this year and we can
see that the initial jobless claims is
no longer on a trend of declining it is
on a trend of increasing and at this
point more and more people who are out
there are finding it very very difficult
to find that same high paying job I mean
I know a lot of people that I was
meeting over the weekend during this
week a lot of family members have been
around and a lot of people been talking
about people that they know who lost
their jobs from major corporations and
they're having a very difficult time
finding new work and they're hoping in
2016 it's going to be getting better and
as we know it's not going to improve
actually we're going to see the opposite
happen we're going to see more and more
people get laid off we're going to see
stores closed down we're gonna see
people laid off in retail we're going to
see corporations lay off more people
saying that our sales are not there we
don't have the revenue and we need to
cut costs we're going to see this
throughout the United States Canada
Europe and many other areas it's going
to get worse as time goes on now America
today is now moving towards a temp
economy at one point it was a full-time
workers economy but there are more than
17 million independent workers today and
they represent a bigger share of the
workforce than ever before now federal
laws they give a lot of protection to
full-time workers you know getting
health benefits or get your pension you
know you have some type of security
which is eroding away and pretty soon
will be non-existent but they still have
some type of security temporary workers
and contract employees it's a completely
different story temp workers they don't
really get health insurance vacation
retirement benefits they are simply paid
for a limit amount of time that they are
needed and then they are disposed of
immediately and we see at this point
that corporation the big corporations
what they're doing and this has been
going on for quite a while but we're
seeing it accelerate at this point
they're getting rid of the full-time
workers they're bringing them back as
part-time this way they don't have to
worry about the pensions they don't have
to worry about the health benefits and
they only have to pay them for a certain
number of hours and we see right now
that this entire middle class is being
destroyed
the country is becoming a temp country
and we see many of the major
corporations like Merck which is one of
the largest pharmaceutical companies and
we know they bring in tons and tons of
money from selling drugs that people
really don't need and basically there's
cutting costs they sold their
Philadelphia Factory and fired 400
employees then they rehired them back as
independent contractors I mean this is
what companies are doing and I remember
a long time ago when I was working for a
corporation where they were basically
getting rid of all the employees an
outsourcing company was coming in and
the outsourcing company was hiring these
people at a lower rate and the company
hired those people back and they didn't
have to worry about benefits they didn't
have to worry about health insurance
they'd have to worry about any of that
and we're starting to see this happen
around the country and it's accelerating
right now middle-class Americans make up
a minority of the population back in
1971 sixty-one percent of all Americans
lived in middle-class households Pew
Research Center has also found that
median wealth for middle-class
households dropped by an astounding 28
percent between 2001 and 2013 there are
still nine hundred thousand fewer
middle-class jobs in America than there
were when the last recession began the
Social Security Administration is
reporting that 51 percent of all
Americans make less than 30,000 a year
an astounding forty eight point eight
percent of all 25 year old Americans
they still live at home with their
parents these young adults coming out of
college coming out of high school they
cannot find the high-paying jobs
especially those who have gone to
they cannot make the payments on their
student loans this is why the government
stepped in and said ok we'll we'll base
your payments on your income think about
that for a second
the US Census Bureau says forty nine
percent of all Americans now live in a
in a home that receives money from the
government each month 47 million
Americans are living in poverty right
now and this is getting worse and worse
not getting better because when we go
back in time moving forward we see no
improvement whatsoever
now something big just happening the
Chicago PMI came out with their
information Chicago's business barometer
and it collapsed and we haven't seen
these levels since the last recession
and the last time we saw levels this low
America never avoided a recession and
I'm not even going to call it a

it's going to be a collapse it came in
